column2: 25-34 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient) $1$1$5$After having been on zoloft for almost 3 years with excellent results
column3: it pooped out on me and stopped working. My doctor decided to first max out my zoloft dosage to see if that would help. It somewhat did
column4: but not to out satisfaction and it made me very sedated. We then decided to switch me to prozac as it is the most stimulating and i was looking for something to give me energy. Over several weeks
column5: i weened myself off of the 200mg a day zoloft (down 50mg a week) and up to 60mg proac (20 mg per week until 60mg). The transition period was tough. I was unable to distinguish if the side effects were from discontinuing the zoloft or beginning the proac. By the time I stopped taking the zoloft
column6: I was on 60mg prozac/day. I was irritable
column8: and unable to have a full night's sleep. I would wake up every 1-2 hours. I also have ativan to take when needed and it surely helped with the sleeping and daily panic attacks. after several weeks
column9: I thought that the prozac was beginning to work. However
column10: I was wrong. I had severe side effects that would not go away. Mainly
column13: lack of motivation and concentration. I also noticed bruises on the inside of my thighs that came out of nowhere. I went back to my doctor and we lowered my dose to 40mg/day. a week later
column14: after having the same side effects on top of fever
column16: and just did not feel right. I called my doc and she recommended i go to the ER to rule out neuroleptic malignant sydrome (later found out that is caused by antipsychotics
column17: NOT antidepressants). we decided to end the prozac as it was clearly not working right with my body. I am beginning 10mg of lexapro tomorrow and am trying to be optimistic. I had great success with zoloft until it pooped out and am really hoping that the lexapro will work just as good as the zoloft. I know everyone's mind and body reacts differently
column18: but for me the prozac was a failure. Just work closely wit your doctor
column19: you know your body. Peace to all :)

column1: 19$Anxiousness associated with Depression$9/16/2015 11:11:44 PM$Reviewer: 55-64 Female  on Treatment for 10 years or more (Patient) $5$5$5$I took Prozac for approx. 20 years for anxiety and depression. It worked very well for me all those years. About a year ago I thought I needed to get off of it to clean up my system. Today I started back on it and already feel less anxiety and depression. It has saved my life.
390$Anxiousness associated with Depression$7/25/2019 6:27:02 PM$Reviewer: 35-44 on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient) $4$4$4$"A lot of Drs won't tell women but Sarafem is Prozac
column3: just changed the name because if the reputation that ""Prozac was for crazy people"" it's actual use was for depression
column4: so I've just switched from prozac to Sarafem for the same reason
column5: so if people see the bottle they don't judge you. But just wanted to make sure all of you were aware of this."
